summary: Nullable RequestReference Fix in Lock Management Interface

content.text: You're in the middle of a merge that has been resolved but not completed. To abort this merge:

content.content: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). STOP what you are doing and wait for the user to tell you how to proceed.

toolUseResult: Error: The user doesn't want to proceed with this tool use. The tool use was rejected (eg. if it was a file edit, the new_string was NOT written to the file). STOP what you are doing and wait for the user to tell you how to proceed.

content.text: [Request interrupted by user for tool use]

message.content: Please don't go nuts and just assume anything. The 1 commit that I have must remain. Please do not touch it else you will delete code. I simply want the current merge to be aborted - nothing else.

content.text:
You can abort the current merge while keeping your 1 commit by running:

```bash
git merge --abort
```

This will cancel the ongoing merge and return you to the state before the merge started, preserving your existing commit on the branch.
